III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Placement
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12404
Section (1) An agency shall only place a child with an adult who is a
Description relative of the child, a legal custodian, or in a licensed
foster home, except as permitted in R 400.12503(2)(b) and
R 400.12709.
1

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A was placed in an unrelated/unapproved home by the
agency.
Investigation Allegation was that Youth A was placed in an unapproved home
and the caregiver allowed unapproved contact between Youth A
and the mother of Youth A.
Interviews:
I interviewed the Complainant on 10/25/2024. The Complainant
did not have any additional information to provide.
Agency Director was interviewed by phone on 10/25/2024 and
reported the 3130 evaluation for the caregiver had been
completed to evaluate the placement as a fictive kin placement.
Director subsequently learned that the approved caregiver and
parent were not truthful regarding this relationship with Youth A.
Director also learned the approved caregiver was found to have a
relationship with the mother of Youth A and was allowing contact
between Youth A and Youth A's mother that was not approved by
the supervising agency. The mother of Youth A subsequently
removed Youth A from this placement and the previously
approved caregiver contacted the agency regarding the situation.
Youth A was later located and replaced into a licensed foster
home.
I interviewed Staff 1 by telephone on 2/24/2025. Staff 1 described
the situation consistent with the description reported by Agency
Director. Staff 1 stated the initial visit and interview with the
caregiver did not include any evidence to indicate the caregiver
was not being truthful.
Documents Reviewed:
I reviewed the 5770 – Relative Approval and Placement Safety
Screen that was completed by Staff 1 and approved by Supervisor
1 dated 10/10/2024 for the initial placement of Youth A on
10/10/2024. The initial visit and interview/assessment with the
caregiver did not include any evidence to indicate Youth A should
not be placed in the home.
I reviewed the DHS 3130A – Children’s Foster Care Relative
Placement Home Study that was completed by Staff 1 with a
2

denial recommendation dated/signed by Staff 1 and Supervisor 1
on 10/25/2024. The reason for the denial was learning that the
Fictive Kin had not been truthful in the information provided for the
completion of the previously approved 5770. Youth A was
subsequently replaced into the home of another
appropriate/approved caregiver.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance with Rule R 400.12404 (1).
The 5770 and 3130A evaluations had been completed to
evaluate/approve/deny this placement as a fictive kin. False
information was reported to the agency in the process of
completing the evaluations resulting in a denial recommendation
for the 3130A assessment. The agency subsequently replaced
Youth A into a licensed foster home when it was learned the
previous approval (5770) was determined/based on false
information.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
